steps.title: Hold the balloon in place to keep it from moving around.
steps.content: Hold the balloon in place to keep it from moving around. The balloon is going to move when you try to pop it, so you’ll need to either hold it with a free hand or secure it to a surface. [1] X Research source Try taping the tied-off end of the balloon to a surface using duct tape or another adhesive. Grip the balloon tightly to secure it yourself, holding the tied-off end for the easiest handle.

steps.title: Apply pressure to the balloon if you don’t have a sharp object.
steps.content: Apply pressure to the balloon if you don’t have a sharp object. There are several other ways to pop a balloon if you don’t have a pointy edge. Try using your feet, hands, or any other part of your body to put pressure on the balloon's sides. [2] X Research source Press down on the balloon until it pops — this may take longer than it would to pop the balloon using a sharp object.

steps.title: Use your body to pop the balloon.
steps.content: Use your body to pop the balloon. Try jumping or stomping on the balloon, being careful not to trip or fall over it if it moves while popping. You can also squeeze the balloon to your chest or sit on the balloon, putting pressure on the sides until it pops. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Create an incision in the balloon for a quick pop.
steps.content: Create an incision in the balloon for a quick pop. Find an object with a sharp point, such as a needle or pen. Push the sharp end of the object carefully into the balloon until it creates a pop. [4] X Research source Make sure the balloon is attached to a surface or is being held securely so that you stab the balloon and nothing else. Scissors, safety pins, and forks also work well to pop balloons.

steps.title: Burn the balloon using a lighter.
steps.content: Burn the balloon using a lighter. If you have access to a lighter or matches, a small flame is enough to pop a balloon. Hold the balloon in 1 hand and turn on a lighter with the other hand, putting the flame close to the balloon until it pops. [5] X Research source Always be extra cautious when dealing with fire and make sure that you know how to use a lighter or matches safely before using them at all.

steps.title: Blow air into the balloon until it pops.
steps.content: Blow air into the balloon until it pops. If the balloon isn’t already tied off, you can keep blowing air into the balloon until it eventually pops. Using a smaller balloon will make popping the balloon this way easier as the smaller balloon won’t be able to expand as much.

steps.title: Turn popping the balloon into a game.
steps.content: Turn popping the balloon into a game. To have a little bit of fun while popping a balloon, choose a game-like activity. This could be playing balloon darts where the balloons are secured to a board and you throw darts at the balloons to pop them, or trying to pop a balloon between your legs. Other games include standing back-to-back with someone with the balloon in the middle of your backs as you both try to pop the balloon by pushing back against each other.
